Name: Cow Tipping
Description:
"For generations human teens have crept into pastures at night and tipped over defenseless cows in their sleep.

"Last night they tipped the wrong cow... Elsa was the prettiest in the pasture, and Clyde the Bull was in love.

"Seeking revenge, this morning Clyde rushed onto a nearby highway, causing an auto accident and stopping traffic for miles. Now he's organizing gangs of cows from the pasture to tip cars off the road.

"Watch out world, it's the cows doing the tipping now!"

Collect gangs of cows by drawing cards from the draw pile or your neighbors' discard piles. Use these gangs to tip over the 5 types of vehicle cards in 5 different colors. Your score is based on the set of vehicle cards you tip; Busses are worth more than Cars and Trucks, but they also require a bigger gang to tip over. Motorcycles aren't worth as much, but they're easier to tip (require a smaller gang).

You score for collecting types of vehicles as well as for collecting colors, so you can go for a bunch of Tractors, or you could try to collect all the Blue vehicles.

Name: Road Rage: A card game
Description:
A card game simulating drivers in an apocalyptic future; where raiders and bandits roam the land, taking what they want by sheer force or through brute intimidation.  The players are wanderers; drivers of cars that have been modified to help them endure the perils “out there” as they travel the highways between fortified villages and settlements.

The game can be played by one or more players. Ideally, the game is intended to be played by “more” players but works fine as a solo game. In a multi-player game, the individuals can work together, or against each, or as teams if they have enough players.

The basic component is a standard deck of 52 cards, a token to show the drivers movement across the cards, and two 1d6 to keep track of the drivers two stats: health/speed.

Each player is trying to get his driver across a wasteland of broken roads, and marauding bandits.  The cards themselves are used as the road, modifiers during movement, and combat against marauders or other players.

The card suite and face value will determine the type and strength of encounters the driver will face along the road,  The driver will in turn use their hand of cards to control the speed of their vehicle as well as the strength of their attack and defense.   During a co-op game, the drivers can use their cards to help friendly drivers fight off marauders or control their driving reactions.


The game was designed as part of the Traditional Card Game design contest.

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/421774/page/1

Name: Bobry
Description: 'Bobry' is a simple children's game. It has two variants. One of them - 'Swimmers race' - is a racing game. In the other one - 'Building beaver's lodge' - players collect tokens with elements depicted on them. The first player to collect four different elements of the construction wins the game.

Name: Tacticum
Description:
Are you ready to lead your Legionnaires?!

According to the Gamealogical Institute History Department (wink, wink), this strategy game is derived from teaching methods used in the development of new Centurion Candidates in the far reaches of the north-west during the Late Roman empire.

Protect your flanks, master the use of the column and square formations and prove to the Training cadre that you are ready to lead.  This is a 2 player strategy game with very dynamic play; particularly as columns and square formations can break up and new ones be formed as you direct individual units on the battle field.

Tacticum includes multiple play setups known as "training scenarios".  Additional scenarios are added to the Gamealogical Institute website.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Battlefields of Olympus: Campaigns of Glory
Description:
Expansion for the 2008 release of Battlefields of Olympus.

Campaigns of Glory introduces Campaigns and Mythological Weapons to the battlefield. In addition, there will be more Land Trophies, Actions and Warrior cards.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Guess the Gargoyle
Description:
Object: To be the first player to get his/her gargoyle across the finish line.

Gameplay: Since the identity of gargoyles is hidden, you may be advancing another player's gargoyle. The game board includes SWITCH spaces, LOOK spaces, and LOOK 'N SWITCH spaces.

Box Contents: Board, 4 identical plastic gargoyle figures with different colored dots on bottom of base, 1 d6, instructions.

Name: Lepanto 1571
Description:
The simulation is designed for two players, one with a Muslim fleet and one with a Christian fleet.
Both players should be aware that although they primarily represent admirals with dreams of defeating the whole enemy fleet, they also represent subordinate officers who have personal objectives. They must allow for the wishes of individual captains to seek plunder on wrecked ships before their rivals get to it.

Name: Plei Me 1965
Description:
19 Oct – 26 Nov 1965
A conflict simulation reâ€enacting the battles of October and November 1965 in the Central Highlands of VietNam.

"Plei Me 1965" is a two player wargame simulation recreating the actions of the US 1st Cavalry Division (airmobile) in the Pleiku province of South Vietnam during October and November 1965. The NVA B3 Front had an audacious plan to split South Vietnam in two with a strike through the central highlands, if it wasn’t for the intervention of America’s latest formation in airmobile warfare they could have very well succeeded. The Campaign had many varying types of force engagement; sieges, ambushes, running battles and whole unit encirclements. 
The simulation is meant to reflect the uncertainties in jungle fighting and the rapidly changing situations involved with airmobile operations.

Name: Second Lebanon War: 2006
Description:
This is a solitaire simulation of the Second Lebanon War 2006. The player represents the Israeli supreme political leadership (i.e. the Prime Minister and the War Cabinet) contested by the designed system, representing Hezbullah.

     The player’s aim is to defend his home-front from rockets fired at it by Hezbullah, and to maintain and improve his political conditions, domestically and internationally, towards the end of the game.
     The player must consider various factors that affects the campaign’s outcome: domestic and international political factors, military mobilisation and operational successes and losses.
     The player will keep good record of points on two designated tables: domestic political points and international political points. A third table will be used to keep track of turns. Each turn ends only after playing all phases.
     The initial setting of the simulation represents the first stage of the conflict. Therefore, the player has thirty-three days of war to simulate in eleven turns.

Name: Afghanistan 1980
Description:
Afghanistan 1980 is a strategic simulation of the fight between the Mujahideen and the Armed Forces of the Soviet Union in the unforgiving mountainous terrain of Afghanistan.
The simulation begins in early 1980 after the initial occupation force of the 40th Army has been deployed.

Name: Diplomacy Games and Variants
Description:
From the Inside Cover:

this is a set of variants and games based on Diplomacy, the popular game of international negotiation, intrigue, and warfare (voted Game of the Year in 1976 and 1977 by Games & Puzzles readers).  It is necessary to know how to play Diplomacy in order to use this booklet.  Many of the games also require use of a Diplomacy board and pieces.  Mapsheets are provided for others, but a set of pieces is still required.  In all cases all additional rules needed are included.  The games range from the abstract to World War II to "swords and sorcery", some for fewer than seven players.  They are arranged in a progressive instructive format to enable inexperienced players to learn simple variants first and more complex ones later.  There are also special sections on two - and three - player Diplomacy.

Table of Contents :

Part I Simple Variants
  Simple Variants using the Boxed Game Board
  1939 (World War II)*
  Colonization

Part II Moderate Variants
  Holy Roman Empire
  The Struggle for Hegemony in Europe, 1689-1815*

Part III Complex Variants
  1939 II*
  Realistic Variants
  The Song of the Night: Swords and Sorcery Diplomacy*

Part IV Miscellaneous 
  Two-Player Diplomacy
  Three-Player Diplomacy
  Compilation of Simple Variants

3 11x17 mapsheets are included


     uses separate Mapsheet

Name: ChessCraft
Description:
In the World of ChessCraft, there are 4 races. Each race represented by a different colour. Orc is Red, Undead is Black, Human is Blue and Elf is Green. Each has their own unique abilities to influence the game play. Orc has piece promotion and piece destruction. Undead has graveyard manipulation and piece control. Human has piece position and board manipulation. Elf has card manipulation. The battle has just began!

ChessCraft is an abstract game played with cards, for 1 vs 1 or 2 vs 2 players. Each game takes around 30 min to 1 hr. Contents of the full games are:
a)    32 pieces
b)    75 cards
c)    16 board tiles

The objectives of the game are 
(1) Capture the opponent king 
(2) Accumulate 20 or more cards per player 
(3) When the king reaches the opponent’s summoning board tile

Players take turns to place the board tiles. At the beginning of each player's turn, he draws 1 card from a common draw pile. During his turn, the player has to make a move on one of his pieces. At any time during his turn, he can 
(1) Summon basic or advanced pieces 
(2) Promote basic pieces to advanced pieces 
(3) Play cards

To do these 3 actions, costs must be paid first, which means discarding cards equal to the cost face down to a common discard pile. Whenever a card is played, the opponent may respond by playing a card. Cards are resolved first in last out. During opponent's turn, player may also play cards. Player can also modify the movement, capture or interaction with opposing piece of a piece in play by paying the cost of a Piece Modifier Action card. The effects of the modification lasts only the turn the card is played. Unsummoned pieces are in each player’s reserve. When the pieces are captured (or destroyed), they are placed in each player’s graveyard.

There are 2 types of cards. Actions go to the discard pile face up immediately while Permanents stay in play in front of the player who played them. Kings cannot be targeted or affected by cards unless specified. Player may not Check the opponent if he plays any card prior to his Move.

Each 2x2 board tile has a coloured circle in one of the squares. The circle indicates the square as a terrain of that colour. At the beginning of a player’s turn, if his pieces occupy all 4 terrains of his own colour, he can draw 1 more card.

Discussion forum can be found here
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/3869101#3869101

Name: Recicle
Description:
Recicle, in portuguese.
Recycle is a strategy game about the cycle of organic and recyclable materials in a city.
Each player commands a team of street Collectors (four Collectors for two and three players, three Collectors for four players). They must move and collect materials and take them to the Cooperative. Each player also run a Cooperative business that buy the materials from the teams of Collectors. The Cooperative has a factory of recycled products and a trash yard for organic materials. The Cooperative pays the collecting costs and may hold up to three different equipments to make products from each of the five recyclable materials (paper, glass, long-life/tetra-pak, plastic and metal). 
At the end of every turn, the Cooperative sells their products obtaining qualifying points and Pratas, the money of the game.
When the trash yard is full of materials the game ends. Wins the game the player who gets more qualifying points.

Name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
Description:
Tiger's electronic Who Wants to be a Millionaire? table-top game brings all the excitement of the hit TV quiz show into your home.  One to six players compete for £1,000,000.  Lights, music, sound effects, and Chris Tarrant's voice add to the drama.  Just like on TV, you have 3 lifelines - Fifty-fifty, Ask the Audience, & Phone-A-Friend - to get a little help!

Contents:
Electronic table-top unit
100 double-sided question cards
90 cheques
Families: TV Shows: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire

Name: Luftsturm: Defence of the Reich
Description: Luftsturm is a supplement for Luftwaffe 1946 (required to use it) and comprises 40 pages, plus 4 pull-out card sheets of extra aircraft stats. Roughly half of the book is background, outlining the structure of the Luftsturm and the tactics planned for the various "what if" aircraft featured, while the other half is additional rules, and 10 scenarios that are the real core of the book. These range from small and historical (a Sunderland vs 3 Ju-88s over Biscay) to massive and hypothetical (54 Soviet aircraft pressing home a bombing raid against jet fighters, Ba-349 Natters, and even Zeppelin Rammers....)

Name: Amerika Bomber
Description:
Amerika Bomber is the second supplement to the Luftwaffe 1946: Fight for the Skies game.

"The Americans think they are safe behind their oceans.  They think they can rain fire and destruction upon our people with impunity.  It is time for them to reap what they have sown.  This wonder weapon, forged by the fearless workers of the Reich, will teach the reckless Americans that no one is beyond our reach..." - Adolf Hitler at the christening of the first AR-555 Amerika Bomber

The book includes alternate history and characters from the Luftwaffe 1946.  Additional rules for: Air to Surface Missiles, Ship Statistic Generation.  10 Mission scenarios, 2 Mini-Campaigns and 48 Aircraft Stat Cards.

52pp, black and white, color covers.

Name: Electronic Sound Snap
Description:
It's snap with a twist, don't match the pairs but listen to the sound and then snap a card that matches.

Includes songs, sounds and characters from 6 hit shows: Thomas and friends, Bob the builder, Pingu, Barney, Angelina Ballerina and Fireman Sam.

The cards containing pictures of favourite characters are spread evenly across the floor.  Children then use sticks (or fly swats is a better term) with rubber suckers on the end to pick up the cards when they hear the relevant characters theme tune or catch phrases.

Name: Clash of the Princes
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

At last - a thrilling TWO-PLAYER, two-book Fighting Fantasy adventure!*

The perilous Trial of Kingship awaits you! In the golden city of Gundobad, you are twin princes - one Warrior-Prince and one a Warlock-Prince - each with your own particular skills and strengths. It is time for one of you to succeed to the throne, and you must face the Trial of Kingship. But only one of you can win through. Which brother will it be?

Beware! Vile monsters and deadly dangers lie in wait. Two dice, a pencil, an eraser - and a friend! - are all you need.


    Each book can also be played solo!


Set contains: 
Clash of the Princes - The Warlock's Way
Clash of the Princes - The Warrior's Way

Name: Gotham:  Building the American City
Description:
Gotham is a tile-laying game set around the turn of the twentieth century.  Players take turns laying tiles to complete city blocks, which they can them claim for points.  More residences on each block means more points.  And civic improvements -- such as churches and schools -- can boost the value of a block.  But watch out:  homes can only be built where commerce supports it.  And urban blights -- like jails and slums -- can reduce a profitable city block into a landlord's nightmare.

This is a free print and play game.  It uses graphics from old insurance maps, and produces a lovely tabletop!

Name: Star Wars: Destroy Death Star Game
Description:
Based on the game box photos, it appears to incorporate a space themed grid made up of connected circles (rather than more common hexagons or squares).  It appears players race across the grid, avoiding or destroying tie fighters along the way to the Death Star.  One space looks to be the "vent" in the Death Star that players are likely vying for.

This seems to be a either a UK or at least European release only.

Though named the same as Star Wars: Destroy Death Star Game, these are much different games.

Name: Build A House
Description: A tile-based game published by The National Trust of Great Britain & Northern Ireland. Players construct period buildings from a pool of 100 tiles.

Name: MagiFlux
Description:
MagiFlux is a card game for 2-4 players. The inspiration for this game came from Fluxx and Magic:The Gathering.

Objective of the game is to be the first to have cards in play that have a total of 10 Victory Points.

At the beginning of each turn, a player takes the top card from his own library, and untaps all resources. During each turn, a player may play 1 card face down as a resource. Resources and cards played remain in play.To play a card, pay by tapping the number of resources equal to its cost. Each card's cost is also worth the same amount of Victory Points.

Player may activate the abilities on his cards in play. Ability costs must be paid or triggered before the ability is resolved. Costs are usually related to player's own cards. A player is out of the game if he has no cards in his library.

Name: Greyhound Obstacle Race
Description:
A simple roll and move game from probably the 1930's. It was produced in London, England and has a separate game board with 100 spaces, each numbered consecutively, and a small box that contains the game component. The box contains a die cup for rolling the 1 D6 die and 4 different colored plastic greyhound pieces. The rules are printed on the game box's inside cover.
 The game is for 2-4 players. You roll the die to move your dog around the game board. A six is needed to start the race and will also net you another turn during the game. As the dogs move on the board they can land on special spots that can aid or hinder the player's piece. Some spots allow another roll or to move ahead extra spaces. Some force you to lose a turn or move back. If your dog lands on another player's piece. The other player’s dog is sent back to the start. An exact roll is needed to win by landing on the 'Hare' space, number 100.

Name: Star Wars Electronic Laser Battle Game
Description: This is a 2 player dexterity game where players are attempting to battle their way to the death star and destroy it.  Players have to test their reaction speeds in tie fighter battles.  The first one in each round to hit the correct weapon button, has one of 6 LEDs illuminated on the path to the Death Star in the middle.  Once there, they have the chance to destroy the Death Star if they can win a final battle.

Name: Playmobil: Dinoworld
Description:
Small children's coop game in which you try to save the dinosaurs from an erupting vulcano.

Dinosaur counters come in four distinct colors. They are mingled with some explorer counters and then put face down in the middle of the table.

The players take turns in rolling the die. When one of the colors turns up, the player throws a cardboard lasso, trying to catch one or more counters. Those are turned faced up and the ones matching the color of the die roll are considered rescued and taken out of the game. Explorer counters are simply taken out of the game. Non matching counters are turned face down again.

When a vulcano is thrown, one of five vulcano pieces is turned over. When all five pieces are turned over the game is lost. If players succeed in rescueing all dinosaurs before that happens, they win the game jointly.

WARNING: the Playmobil theme is a loose one and although the cover art suggests that you might expect to find some real dinosaur playing pieces in the box, this is a plain cardboard game.

Name: Ekodetektyw
Description: Ekodetektyw was published in cooperation with NFOÅšiGW (roughly: National Environment Protection and Water Economy Fund). Its goal is to educate children about what is harmful to the environment and what they can do to protect it. Players move their pieces in various directions to collect tokens. Pictures on the tokens are connected with pollution, global warming, endangered species, recycling etc. The aim is to collect more pairs of tokens than other players. The winner gains the title of 'great ecologist'.

Name: Marvel Superstars TCG
Description:
CANCELLED GAME

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Marvel Superstars TCG will not enter production.  This entry currently serves as a placeholder for the announced item and will likely later be removed.

    


Marvel Superstars TCG is a new game based on the Marvel Universe as envisioned by the movies.  This is first time that the movies, including Iron Man, Hulk, Fantastic Four, the X-Men Trilogy, the Blade Trilogy and others, will interact with each other in a Marvel game.

A Starter Deck will be the first release, followed a few weeks later by the Booster Packs. Approximately 300 cards will be released in the first set.

Each player chooses to become a classic Marvel hero or villain, then constructs a team to defeat the opponent.

Name: Journal Singapore
Description:
From the game's website: 
"Journal Singapore is the first board game to feature the history of Singapore over a period of three eras(1900 - 1965). Take on the role of pioneers and leave a legacy of prestige and influence; or find yourself consigned to the dustbin of history. Struggle to survive and thrive in the face of foreign domination, drastic resource shortages and vicious infighting; work with other players to see the dawn of an independent nation (or trample them into the dirt).

Journal Singapore is an easy to learn strategic boardgame that is suitable for two kinds of play; play a single era for a fast game or play competitively throughout the three eras.

Players choose their favourite character and pit their wits (and character traits) against other players while trying to survive the obstacles and effects of real historical events."

The game contains:

•1 Foldable game board (11.75" x 8.25")
•1 "Merlion" Counter
•6 Pioneer Cards 
•27 Sector Cards
•36 Event Cards
•60 Plan Cards
•100 Currency Notes (Resource)
•6 Coloured Play Pieces
•60 Influence Counters 
For 3 - 5 players, age 10 and above. Approximate playing time: 45mins - 120mins

Name: The Scottish Malts
Description:
Barley, wheat, rye.

All the ingredients for the great scottish malts: whiskey and beer.

Add Peat as a source of energy, and throw all your ressource cubes down the cube tower. That's right: a cube tower, à la Wallenstein/Shogun.

Players will produce barrels of whiskey and beer from the 3 ingredients and ship them through Scotland.

Prices and demand will ebb and flow as the players try to amass the most money.

Name: Card Race
Description:
Full of pep.
Not much is known about this antique bcard game. The box contents a board to mark a score. You're supposed to use a own deck of cards.

Name: Tōkai yūkyōden ~ Jirochō sangokushi
Description:
This is an area control game covering struggle for gambling around the Tokaido road at the end of the Edo period.

Components:

    16 page rulebook
    1 map (with old-taste touch)
    72 counters (large size with ukiyoe taste illustration)


Note: æ¬¡éƒŽé•·ä¸‰å›½å¿— (Jiro leader of the three prefectures) is a novel based on Kiyoshi Shimizu's (æ¸…æ°´æ¬¡éƒŽé•·) life, who was a famous yakuza during 19th century.
æ±æµ·-éŠ-ä¾ -ä¼ Tokai - play - chivalry - legend

Name: Stripster
Description: A variation on Twister and stripping.  Players spin and either put a hand or foot on the mat - or they are forced to remove clothing.

Name: Чёрный принц (The Black Prince)
Description: Ð§Ñ‘Ñ€Ð½Ñ‹Ð¹ ÐŸÑ€Ð¸Ð½Ñ† ("The Black Prince") is a card wargame for two players about Hundred Years War. Each player may choose for fight one of four army: English, French, Scottish or army of Burgundy. The player who destroyed six enemy groups - win the game.

Name: Undersea Warriors
Description:
From the introduction:

"Undersea Warriors is a game of tactical combat between U-boat, or Submarine, and Destroyer, or anti-Submarine vessel. These are essentially non-nuclear "type" vessels, reflecting hypothetical combat which could be all the way from the middle of World War II, to the 1960's."

The game appears to have come in a large ziplock bag with the following components:
- Rule Book (139 pages with additional charts in back).
- Map (A large hex map with a coordinate system running down two edges)
- 12 Submarine/Counter sheets (Each heavy paper sheet is identical and has two basic elements: 1. An area to cut out counters for ships, torpedoes, etc.; and 2. Player sheets to track damage, etc., on two different, and somewhat odd looking, submarines.

Name: Ozone
Description:
Ozone is a 3 in-a-row game.

Players take turns placing blocks. When you place a block you can score any combos caused by that block's creation. A combo must include the block just placed, and consists of adjacent blocks when viewed from any of the 5 possible directions (like in Rumis or Pueblo) - the blocks must LOOK adjacent, not necessarily be adjacent. The rules variations differ only in which combos score.

There are rules for two different games - OZONE and 3NOZO. In OZONE they score for each OOO or O3 combo that they create themselves. In 3NOZO one player scores for OOO and O3 combos, while the other scores for NNN, N3, ZZZ, NZZ (Ns and Zs are functionally equivalent), but in this case they score for combos created by either player.

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Planetary Empires
Description:
From the back of the box:

Planetary Empires is an expansion for Warhammer 40,000 that provides players with a plastic map-building kit.  Rules are included that allow players to carve out their own empire by fighting battles using the Warhammer 40,000 rules.

Name: Play Like A Champion
Description: A trivia soccer game. When the CD is played, every player listens and tries to answer the questions. The questions areasked by Jack van Gelder. There are about 500 questions.

Name: Piranha Attacke
Description: Roll a colour die and then use your piranha to try to catch the correct coloured fish. Catching the wrong coloured fish gives a penalty.

Name: De Helden van Disney: Pixar
Description:
A CCG of Disney / Pixar released for the super market company Delhaize in Belgium. Each package includes 5 cards with the entire collection existing out of 216 cards.

The rules for the game are simple: Every player takes at least 5 cards face down. Now the first player takes the first card from his deck and chooses one of the four characteristics (friendship, courage, leadership or star quality) which all have a specific score. After choosing the category the player places the card on the table so that everybody can see it. Now the other players take the first card from their own deck and compare the score of the choosen characteristic. The player with the highest score on that characteristic wins the round. The game goes on until one person has won all the cards in the game.

For collecting purposes people have made their own interpretation of the game or let the winner choose a card from one of the losers decks.

Name: Bailen
Description:
Play the French disaster of disasters in three hours.

The objective is to make a fast-played and fundamentally simple campaign system that can be used for most wars of the 1700-1880 period. The system will focus on command and have a distinct "you are here" -feel. The system rules will be a maximum of 16 pages long including examples and notes and a lot of pictures.
Nothing is set in stone, yet, but the scale is something like 1500 meters per hex and three turns per day (morn, noon, night). Units will be divisions and brigades.
Combat happens in hex during movement. There will be no chits drawn out of cups, but there will be messengers carrying orders around on the map. There will be no rules with French names, but there will be a stress on the quirks of characters involved.

Name: Battlestations: Deep Ones in Deep Space
Description:
This is an mini module for Battlestations, the board game of starship adventure.  It allows players to tackle Lovercraftian Horrors.

From the game itself:
"Adventures in the Rift.  Discover what stirs after the beacon at Far Innsmouth shines a new light in deepest, darkest space.

Bring Lovecraftian horror to your Battlestations universe.

New equipment, a new species (Eugenes), new special abilities and new actions (including the new skill: Sanity!)

This book includes over 2 dozen threaded missions with different finales and a collection of short stories written in the vein of Howard Phillips Lovecraft. "

Name: Pyramida
Description:
TURNS
At each turn, each player moves a friendly stone.:
Stones move to one diagonally adjacent empty cell (forward or backward).
A stone is removed if it reaches the pyramid top (cell k14).

ATTACKS
There are no captures, but enemy stones can be delayed in two ways:
By contact: If a stone moves forwards to a cell adjacent to an enemy stone, then this stone moves diagonally backwards to an empty cell. If the enemy stone cannot retreat (because both cells are occupied) the actual player gets an extra move.
By column: if there are exactly one black and one white stone at a column, the higher stone can be attacked. If the other player moves one stone forward to that column, the upper stone is placed in an empty cell on the lowest row of that column (which is accessible by a sequence of moves: in a chess-like board, the game only uses black squares). If the enemy stone cannot retreat (it was at the fifth row) the current player gets an extra move.
If both attacks occur in a single move, column attacks takes precedence over contact attacks. That is, the player only executes the column retreat. If that retreat is not possible, he executes the contact retreat. If that retreat is also not possible, the player gets an extra move.

LAST STONE
If a player only has one stone, it may move one or two cells (mover's choice) and may retreat one or two cells after an attack by contact (attacker's choice).

GOAL
If a player repeats a position by the third time, he loses.

Name: Munchkin Kill-O-Meter
Description:
The Munchkin Kill-O-Meter allows you to track combat strength during any Munchkin game, including Munchkin Quest, which can be handy since it's easy to lose track of such things in the heat of battle. Each version of the Munchkin Kill-O-Meter includes a two-sided combat counter with which to track your current strength as well as two cards unique to that version. More specifically:


    The initial Munchkin Kill-O-Meter includes one card for the standard Munchkin card game and one card for use in Munchkin Quest.
    Munchkin Zombies Kill-O-Meter includes two cards themed for Munchkin Zombies, while also being usable in any Munchkin game.
    Munchkin Cthulhu Kill-O-Meter, as you might guess, includes two cards themed for Munchkin Cthulhu.
    Munchkin Apocalypse Kill-O-Meter includes eighty-seven, I mean, two cards themed for Munchkin Apocalypse.
    Munchkin Steampunk Kill-O-Meter comes packaged with, yes, two cards themed for Munchkin Steampunk.
    Munchkin Pathfinder Kill-O-Meter comes packaged with Four cards themed for Munchkin Pathfinder.
    Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 Kill-O-Meter comes packaged with Four cards themed for Munchkin Warhammer 40,000.
    Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar Kill-O-Meter comes packaged with Four cards themed for Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

Name: +6 Bag O' Munchkin Babes
Description:
Another Official Munchkin Plastic Bag!  Extra bonus -- free Munchkins!

These six female Munchkin pawns are scheduled to appear in a 2010 Munchkin Quest supplement . . . but if you want them early, here they are! You get one in each of the six Munchkin Quest player colors. The obvious thing to do would be to throw them into your Munchkin Quest box along with the ones that came with the game, and use the correct pawn for whatever sex you character happens to be at that moment.

But if you are truly evil -- and your friends let you get away with it -- you'll show the world just what a munchkin you really are by using the Munchkin Babes in other games.

In Munchkin

Any time you are entitled to go up a level -- or when you do something that WOULD earn you a level if you weren't already Level 9 -- you may, instead, place a munchkin pawn in front of you. In any combat, you may discard it for a 1d6 bonus. You may only have one in front of you at a time. Unless, of course, you "lose" these rules and tell the other players that you're allowed to have more. Six is a good number.

In Other Games

Because you're a munchkin, you may claim a munchkin advantage for using these pawns in ANY game. For instance:


    In any roll-and-move game, if you use the munchkin as your pawn rather than one that came with the game, then once per game you may add or subtract 1 space to the move you roll. 
    In any game in which you start with money, if you use the munchkin as your pawn you start with 10% extra. Round up, of course. 
    In chess, a munchkin pawn can move forward two spaces at any time. 


If you create your own official rules for using the Munchkin pawn in other games, please share your rules with us at the Steve Jackson Games forums.

Name: Corporate Espionage
Description:
Corporate Espionage is a card game that represents a battle between freshly-funded startup companies who all have similar ideas and are entering the same target market. Each company must ramp up quickly in order to compete... and when that fails, take out the competition by any means necessary.
 
     Hire and fire employees and executives to build your team
     Equip the team with tools to do the job
     Use business skills and savvy to get an edge on the competition
     Drive competitors to bankruptcy with corporate espionage
     Last company standing wins!



Each deck contains 80 unique, illustrated cards.

--From the Publisher's website

Name: Western Desert Force
Description:
In September 1940, Italian divisions rolled over the border between their colony of Libya and British-dominated Egypt. After advancing several dozen miles they stopped to secure their supply lines, only to meet a devastating British counter-attack that soon had them reeling back halfway across Libya. For the next two and a half years, Axis and Allied armies surged back and forth across the North African desert until finally Gen. Bernard Law Montgomery's British Eighth Army wrecked Erwin Rommel's vaunted Panzer Army Africa.

Western Desert Force: The Desert Campaign 1940-1942 is a quick-playing game from the same designer as our Defiant Russia, following the same philosophy: a game you can play in just an hour or two, with the emphasis on tense action and lots of fun.

The map portrays the North Africa from El Agheila to Alexandria. It's divided into hexagons, at a scale of 15 miles across each.

Players control the actual units that fought in this campaign. Units are divisions, brigades and regiments with some battalions. The Axis player controls German, Italian and Italian Colonial (Libyan) units; the Allied player leads British, Australian, New Zealand, South African, Indian, Polish, Jewish, Free French and Greek units in the fight against fascism.

The objectives for each side are simple: kick the enemy out of North Africa. The strategy is not so easy: the Allies must hold on to protect the Suez Canal; the Axis must choke off this vital waterway. Neither can afford to be ejected from the otherwise worthless desert.

The game design is by William Sariego, and development is by industry veteran Paul Dangel in his Avalanche Press debut.

Western Desert Force includes:

     One 33"x17" map
     Full-color play aids
     140 game pieces
     16-page rulebook


Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 15 miles / 24 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Division

Game Inventory:
Three 11 x 17" full color maps
One dual-side printed countersheet (140 1/2" counters)
One 16-page Western Desert Force rulebook
Three single-side printed Player Aid cards
One dual-side printed Random Events Card
Two 6-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-4 hours

Name: Mithril Miners
Description:
"Mithril! All folk desired it. It could be beaten like copper, and polished like glass; and the Dwarves could make of it a metal, light and yet harder than tempered steel. Its beauty was like to that of common silver, but the beauty of mithril did not tarnish or grow dim." - Gandalf the Grey

In Mithril Miners, each player controls a family of dwarves working for a Mithril sword manufacturing company.   Each turn, players take turns allocating one shift of their workers to various parts of the manufacturing process, and have to balance cooperation (in order to fulfil the company's orders on time) against the need to outperform the other families and have the highest status at the end of the game.

Name: Paddle Battle
Description: A 2 player action packed game of paddling a ball into your opponents goal while keeping that same ball out of your own goal.

Name: In-Door Baseball
Description: A simple baseball simulation that determined play results by using different spinning tops.

Name: Covered Wagon Trail
Description: Roll and move around the track game for children which also contained another game - Steer Roping.

Name: Crazy Alley
Description:
"A Goofy Game with Giggles Galore"

A dexterity game involving rolling a ball down the board and avoiding or using obstacles to land into different scoring holes.

Name: Katzenjammer Kids Hockey
Description: A dexterity game where you flick wooden pucks into a stand up game board into various holes.  Features images of the famous Katzenjammer Kids.

Name: Radio Ramble
Description:
A roll-and-move game in which the board is a map of the United States, with certain spaces designated with cities' radio stations. Players start from Station WEAF in New York and make a "complete circuit" around the country.

The game features an unusual mechanism for movement. Instead of a die or spinner, players use a "radio tuner" with two turning card discs. Shutter windows in the tuner reveal a station call sign (like WEAF) on one side and a number on the other. Players look up the station on the back of the tuner, where it is associated with a numerical value; that value is then added to the number revealed on the front. Therefore, if a player "tunes in" to Station WMC (Memphis), and the number 3, they then look on the back to see that WEC has a value of 1. That player then moves 3+1 spaces on the board.

If players land on the same station they "tuned in" on their turn, they get a free extra turn. Players must "tune in" an exact number of spaces to finish their route and end on WEAF back in New York.

Name: Red Ryder's 3 Game Set
Description:
3 game set featured the following titles:

Ambushed
Desert Towns
Steer Roping

All are basic roll and move games for children.

Name: Squad Car
Description: Police themed game with a cool looking game board and metal cars.  A spinner and some cards create different movement options. The game has 6 cars. The bank robbers have 3 getaway cars the police have 3 Squad Cars plus the police have 3 roadblocks that can be used to block 3 street exits or avenues leading off of the board. The movement of cars is regulated by a spinner and also by radio flashcards sent from Police Headwuarters to the Squad Cars. The spinner regulates movement. Spin the dila and if the arrow is yellow then spin again until the spinner points either red or green where the cop either stops or moves the indicated number of squares. If all getaway cars are captured by the Squad Cars the police have won. If just one getaway car escapes then the bank robbers have won the game.

Name: Tisch Federball
Description:
Board game badminton!

Features tiny badminton rackets and equally small shuttlecocks.  Points are scored when the shuttlecocks land in different holes on your opponent's side of the board.

Name: What's the Answer?
Description: Spin and spinner that lands on a letter of the alphabet and then draw a card that asks a question of which you need to come up with an answer that begin with the letter you've spun.

Name: Bulge 20 Expansion Kit
Description:
Desperate measures are the order of the day as the Germans and Americans square off at the Battle of the Bulge. With the 12 additional cards included, the Germans can conduct the von der Heydete airdrop, push forward their Jadgtigers, form Kampfgruppen or commit their very last reserves. New cards for the Allied hand include SHAEF, carpet bombing, a 'fortified goose egg,' and The Red Ball Express. Optional rules include traffic control, attack coordination, and a terrific system for mixing up event opportunities and varying the 'storyboard' of the Bulge campaign!

Notice: the Bulge 20 Expansion Kit is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Bulge 20  to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Number of Players: 2
Ages: 12 and up
Playing Time: approximately 75 minutes
Complexity: 4 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 3 on a 9 scale
Scale: Armies organized around Corps units (to provide "steps")

Game Components:

> 6 Allied Staff cards
> 6 German Staff cards
> One 2-page instruction sheet
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition): The Frostmarch Expansion
Description:
Can you overcome the bone-chilling storms and strange creatures or will your blood freeze when you behold the Ice Queen's cold, cruel gaze?

The Frostmarch expansion features 4 new character cards and plastic figures, 84 Adventure Cards, 20 Spell Cards, 24 Warlock Quest Cards, and 3 Alternative Ending Cards - including a final climactic battle with the Ice Queen.

Brace yourself against the onslaught of the Frostmarch!

Expands:

    Talisman: Revised 4th Edition

Name: Seafood Express
Description:
Seafood Express is a dice game for 3 to 5 seafood chefs.
Players run a hawker stall in Singapore serving delicious seafood dishes. The key to a successful business is to serve your customers as fast as you get your ingredients - that way they know they are getting only the freshest produce.

The object of the game is to gain the most points by picking the freshest seafood and serving it up to complete seafood menus. Each menu requires accompanying beverages and usually includes a vegetable dish. If you’re short of a precious ingredient you can always use a couple of coins to buy what you need.

This game was published on BGG in this thread:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/428877/page/4
The mechanics of the game are similar to that found in Seafood Express

Name: Echo
Description:
Echo is a LDS quiz game similar in style to Family Feud. The game comes with questions that were asked of 100 LDS church members. Players must try to give the most popular answer from that survey result. For example, for the question "Name a state other than Utah where many Latter-day Saints reside," the answers were: California (41), Idaho (32), Nevada (15), and Arizona (12). Players earn points by matching the most popular answers.

The game has rules for two players or teams.

Name: Celebrity Chef! The Game
Description:
Celebrity Chef! The Game combines equal parts food and fun. It's a board game packed with more challenges than a week in Gordon Ramsay's kitchen! For home cooks, restaurant diners and those just hungry for fun, Celebrity Chef will satisfy your appetite.

How many foodie movies do you know? 
Can you name the celebrity chef Muppet? 
Do you know your ingredients from Absinthe to Zest? 
Can you describe the difference between braising and baking? 
Take a spin around the board and see what you know. Trivia questions, food factoids and open-ended challenges let you show off your food chops. With hundreds of cards you won't run out of ingredients for cooking up a good time.

Name: Catan: Indiana & Ohio
Description:
This map was a promotional give away at GenCon '09.  It was done in commemoration of GenCon and Origins being held in Indiana and Ohio, respectively.  There were two other maps given away:  'Settlers of Hesse' and 'North Rhine - Westphalia.'

It is a pre-printed map that requires the base game to play.

From the map:

In order to settle this map, you need the game pieces and cards from The Settlers of Catan game.  You will also need (separate/different) markers for gold pieces and victory points (VPs): you can use chips from the Seafarers expansion, or, alternatively, coins.

Name: Dorking 1875: The German Conquest of Britain
Description: From the publisher "In 1871 a serving British officer called GT Chesney wrote a short story that sent shockwaves through Victorian Britain. Frustrated by the state of the army, he wrote "The Battle of Dorking", the story of Britain's invasion and total defeat at the hands of a newly-united Germany. It was to influence both literature and British army reform for years to come. "1875: The Battle of Dorking" allows two players to find out what might have happened at the key battle of this fictional campaign. Along with the rules and all the cut-outs needed, full background notes are given regarding Chesney's original book, the context of the campaign and the weaponry, organisation and tactics of both armies. A game should last two hours on a first play, reducing to 90 minutes once familiar with the rules."

Name: Ben 10 Alien Force Trading Card Game
Description:
Based on the second Ben 10 series, each card in this game represents a character from the show, including Ben and Gwen Tennyson, Kevin Levin, and the aliens Ben turns into, as well as the enemies they fight to protect earth.

Players each play one card per turn, which engages the enemy in battle.  Each card has a series of Battle Elements, as well as which battle element the opposing character will use that turn.  The character with the highest battle value is victorious, and the loser draws a number of cards based on the damage dealt.  The winner is the player who makes their opponent draw their last card.

Name: Strafe
Description: Strafe is a Fox Games original sci-fi print-and-play board game set in the style of a coin-operated arcade game. Race through the terrain, destroy the primary target, and earn the highest score. Oh, and the clock counts against you.

Name: Zoom The Airplane Card Game
Description:
Each card in this game features a portrait of a vintage World War II airplane, the plane's name and country of origin, and a number value.
The set consists of 36 cards, 9 each of blue, red, black, and yellow, and the instructions.

This object of the game is to win all (or most) of the cards in the deck from the other players. As in the game War higher numbered cards prevail. In case of a tie, the cards go to the player who most quickly calls out "Zoom".

Players learn the names and nationalities of the warplanes from the pictures on the face of the cards in the course of playing.

Name: AT-43 Army Book: Cog
Description:
A 64 page supplement for the pre-painted miniatures game AT-43 with background and rules for using the collectivist and revolutionary Red Blok army in the game. Adds complete details for the first new army not found in the original game. Printed in full color.

It contains everything you need to know to play with or battle against the Cogs:
- Exclusive information on the history of the Cogs, their
lifestyle of their clones and the lines they create;
- The army rules of four Cog factions: A-volution, C-naps, G=nocrat and T-regulator;
- The story and rules of the Original ones;
- The rules for the Cogs’ genetic resources and armored fighting vehicles;
- Revelations concerning the evolutionary perspectives of their species!

Name: AT-43 Army Book: Oni
Description: A 64 page supplement for the pre-painted miniatures game AT-43 with background and rules for using the collectivist and revolutionary Oni army in the game. Adds complete details for the first new army not found in the original game. Printed in full color.

Name: Chantecler: The Great Card Game
Description:
There are four suits, Hen, Ducks Goose, and Turkey.Each suit is numbered 1 to 10. There are four cards which are always trumps, no matter what the suit is:

    Chantecler (Rooster)
    Peacock
    Pheasant
    Owl


The persons sitting opposite are partners. Every player gets 11 cards. Each player then bids in privilege of naming the trump. The highest bidder decides the suit he/she selects for trump and all players discard down to 6 cards.
The player naming the trump then plays face up in the center of the table a card of the suit he/she has named, with as aim winning as many of the counter cards as possible.

Then the next player plays a card of the suit named. The player with the highest values takes the four cards.(called The Trick). After the first Trick is played its optional whether or not trumps are lead.

Scoring:

When the hand is finished, each side adds together the counter cards (1,3,5 and the trump cards) which they have taken and credit to their score. If a bidder fails to make as many points as he/she bid, he/she is said to be set, and the number bid is subtracted from his score.  The first side scoring 56 points wins the game.

Name: An Abominable Kind of War:  The Conflict for North America 1755-1761
Description:
"The ferocity and insolence of these black-souled barbarians makes one shudder.  It is an abominable kind of war.  The air one breathes is contagious of insensibility and hardness."
-Louis Antoine, Comte de Bougainville

An Abominable Kind of War, presents the players with a juxtaposition; on the one hand, you have the stylized warfare of 18th century Europe, embodied in the Regular Infantry of the Line, and the dandified  officers who were habituated to the finery of the courts of England and France, with a mentality little suited to combat in “a labyrinth of forests, without roads;” on the other, the brutal, almost feral type of warfare unleashed in North America in the form of “an invisible enemy, who strikes  and vanishes, swift as the lightning…” whose “ferocity and insolence…makes[sic] one shudder.”

As the French, you must tame the “lords of the wilderness” and harness their fierce art of war without burning up too much materiel on them; though, should you allocate too little in the way of gifts and supplies for your formidable allies, they will return to their haunts in the wild, leaving your undermanned French regiments alone to face the gathering might of Great Britain and her American colonies.  So, can you find the right balance between the ferocious partisan war of the wilderness and the more “civilized” style of war as practiced in Europe?  If so, then perhaps the Marquis de Montcalm, with his French battalions, can stave off his more numerous enemies to the south; perhaps New France can survive the tempest of war.

As the English, you, too, have a difficult “balancing” act to master; you must find a way to placate and protect your fiercely independent, but extremely valuable Colonials.  Without their numbers and forest craft, you stand little chance of besting the potent combination of “unmitigated savages” from the Lakes, Mission Indians from the St. Lawrence Valley, Canadian bush rangers, and French battalions which will be coming at you in waves.  Ask too much of the Americans; do too little on their behalf; treat them with disrespect; they will turn a deaf ear to your entreaties and allow the British Regulars to march off to certain defeat out there, at the hands of a foe who is covered “by the universal forest.”

And, facing both of you, is “an immense uninhabited wilderness, overgrown everywhere with trees and brushwood, so that nowhere can one see twenty yards.”  This vast, uncharted forest dominates the struggle.  Ultimately, victory will only go to that player who can conquer that savage landscape stretching out before him.  It is the “insidious warfare of the forest,” then, which will determine the outcome of this struggle!

Name: Posthumous Z
Description:
It has been 2 days since the zombie outbreak. A handful of cliché characters have managed to survive the onslaught by holing at the center of the town. But a rescue never comes. Worse still, the zombies are beginning to gather on the town. As their numbers grow, so does a strange intelligence in the undead hordes. Time grows short. If the characters wish to survive they have to do it themselves by escaping to the outskirts of the town.

In Posthumous, half the players will command a single cliche character apiece, while the other half direct hordes of themed zombies. The town's layout, characters' and zombies strengths and weaknesses are all randomized each game, making every play through a distinguished experience. While on the surface, Posthumous's humor celebrates the proud history of the Zombie Flick, the game is at its core one of cunning and tactical use of your entire team's abilities.

Posthumous's unique mechanics reduce downtime and keep the players plotting, laughing, and guessing. Games of up 10 players can expect their games to last no longer than games with only 4.

Name: Constelações
Description:
Is a 2-player abstract game about collecting stars to create constellations. In the end the player with most constellations full of stars wins.

É um jogo abstrato para 2 pessoas, onde os jogadores devem pegar estrelas e formar constelações. No final o jogador com mais constelações (e com mais estrelas) é o vencedor.


Status of the game: prototype and playtest

Estatus do jogo: prototipação e playteste

Name: Close Action: Naval Warfare in the Age of Napoleon, 1793-1815
Description:
Close Action is a realistic game system that recreates tactical naval combat during the wars of the French Revolution and Empire, better known as the Napoleonic era.

Close Action is a simultaneous movement game. At the beginning of each game turn, all players plot their actions for that game turn on ship logs. The plots are then revealed and executed simultaneously.

Includes: Rules Booklet, Scenario & Tournament Rules Booklet, Four cardstick sheets (blue, red, green, and yellow), 3 color glossy counter sheet, 2 blank ship log sheets, and a message form for multi player games.

Not included but needed to play: a mapboard gridded into regular hexagons and two 6 sided dice
Families: Series: Close Action (Clash of Arms Games)

Name: Bayonet & Ideology: Spanish Civil War (1936 – 1939) Battle Rules for 15mm Figures and Models
Description: A 16 pages rulebook (with the back cover having tables) with rules for wargaming the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) using 15mm Miniatures and Models.

Name: Cycleopoly
Description: Ride On. What brings about more pure, uncomplicated joy than a Bike Ride? Here's a game applauding the greatest invention of all time. Choose your cycling token and advance to pedal. In Cycle-opoly, players buy favorite bikes, accessories and bike rides across the country and increase the value by collecting Rides and Big Fun. Pick up a Bike Lane card you might be president of The Kicking Asphalt Bike Racing Club or you may be riding with Quads O Fire. Flip the deeds over and learn fun facts about different types of bikes, some of the country's most well known rides and races, and cycling trivia. It's all fun and games until someone lands on FLAT TIRE and is off the road for three turns.

Name: Grimassimix
Description:
Players attend the Clown School Grimassimix, where making faces is subject matter instead of maths and languages – to the student’s delight. Sticking out their tongues and wrinkling their noses; everything’s allowed when players try to imitate the faces on the cards. After all, they are trying to trains their facial muscles, aren’t they? The game comes with a little mirror to control your funny faces. The player, who recognizes most of the faces, wins the game.

Grimassimix is a unique board game to tackling the topic of speech therapy. The game focuses on the training of facial motor skills and has been developed by a team of four speech therapists with years of professional experience.

Name: Battle for the Belt
Description:
"What are you made of? Do you have what it takes to wrestle your way to the TOP? Get ready to rock the ring,`cuz here your chance! Challenge your opponents to the ultimate match! Become the World Wrestling Federation Champion. Out-maneuver your enemies, win high-dollar endorsements and avoid costly injuries that put you out-of-commission -- all in the name of the World Wrestling Federation! Winner takes it ALL!" (from the box)

Official World Wrestling Federation Championchip Board Game

The rules includes 3 variants of play: 
- A short version (10 minutes)
- Alternate Play (20 minutes)
- Tag Team Match (30 minutes max of 8 players)

Box includes:
1 six sided die,
2 battle boulders (49mm d20)
8 wwf super stars,
28 cards
1 the ring (board)

Name: Lucky Thirteen
Description:
Lucky Thirteen or "Three Thirteen" is a game of chance and hand-management for 2 to 7 players.

The game uses played with two standard poker decks with the Joker cards included.

It is played in eleven rounds with the hand size increasing by one card with each successive round. In the first round, each player is dealt 3 cards, in the second round, each player is dealt 4, and so on until the last round in which each player has 13 cards.

The object of the game is to be the player with the fewest points by the end of the game.

Name: My First Tell the Time Game
Description: My First Tell the Time Game is an educational game that teaches children how to read clock faces by matching cards with clock images to various times.

Name: Paragon's New Aerial Dogfight Rules 1916-1918
Description: 16 page rulebook for aerial dogfighting during the years of 1916-1918. The rules are designed for 1/300th, scale metal models.  Comes with playsheets containing aircraft data.

Name: Gear Krieg Wargaming Companion
Description:
From the back of the book:

The Companion is a must-have handbook for all Gear Krieg field commanders. In addition to new units and weaponry, it includes advanced rules for artillery support, specialized infantry equipment, combat engineering and much more. The book also features a primer on small units tactics and a step-by-step scenario generator to quickly establish the setting and background of tabletop battles of any size.
The gear Krieg Wargaming Companion features:
- Artillery Support;
- Fortifications and Field Engineering;
- Heroes and Special Characters;
- Hidden Set-up Rules;
- Infantry Special Equipment;
- WWII Tactical Primer;
- Scenario Generator;
- Complete Campaign Rules;
- And scores of vehicles in an easy-to-use datacard format.
Possession of the basic Gear Krieg Rulebook (DP9-501) is required to use this book.

Name: Gear Krieg Axis Sourcebook
Description:
From the back of the book:

Nazi Germany, Imperial Japan, Fascist Italy – the three nations united by the Pact of Steel to form an Axis around which the world was to revolve. Three highly disparate countries, led by cruel regimes intent on conquering the world and bending it to fit their twisted vision of the future. By blood, sweat and superscience, they aimed to divide the world amongst themselves... or destroy it if they could not have it all.
This Gear Krieg supplement features:
- A brief history and overview of each nation's ground armed forces;
- Basic tables of oganization for the forces of Germany, Imperial Japan and Italy;
- Advanced rules for new Axis vehicles, weapons and units;
- Six tactical scenarios;
- Game statistics for over fifty combat vehicles.
Possession of the Gear Krieg rulebook (DP9-501) is required to use this manual. Possession of the Wargaming Companion (DP9-503) is recommended.
Stock number: DP9-505

Name: Gear Krieg Allies Sourcebook
Description:
From the back of the book:

The United States, the Commonwealth, the Soviet Union – the Allies. Very different countries, united in the crucible of war to defend the Free World against the growing darkness of Fascism. Thrown against their will in a maelstrom of conflict, they are Freedom's last defenders.
This Gear Krieg supplement features:
- A brief history and overview of each nation's ground armed forces;
- Basic tables of organization for the forces of the United States of America, the British Commonwealth and Soviet Russia;
- Advanced rules for new Allies vehicles, weapons and units;
- Game statistics for over fifty combat vehicles.
Stock number: DP9-506

Name: Super Mario Brothers Adventure DX
Description:
This is one of the board game version of the famous video game.
It used the story setting of the first Super Mario Brothers in 1980s.
No more cursor or "A" " B" "start" button, you use cards to the action like walk, jump, even the enemies movement.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Mini-Bingo
Description: Mini-Bingo is a simple matching game in classic Bingo format for children.  Turn over the animal tokens one at a time and whomever has that image on their card may claim it.  A bit of luck is needed to place the six matching cards on one's game board. Whoever is the first to gather the corresponding motifs wins the game. An assigning game for 2-4 players. Comes with 4 game boards with pictures, 24 little cards, and 1 set of game instructions all in a charming tin container.

Name: Akce X
Description:
Plagiat of "Scotland Yard".
Made in Czechoslovakia some time in the late 80s.
One of the players takes on the role of Agent X. His job is to move from point to point around the map of Praha taking taxis, trams, boats or subways. The detectives, the remaining players acting in concert, move around similarly in an effort to move into the same space as Agent X. But while the criminal's mode of transportation is nearly always known, his exact location is only known intermittently throughout the game.

Name: Fruit Salad
Description:
A match-up card game for the whole family.

Players try to match 3 different or identical fruits to score points.
Similar to rummy, this game is easy to learn and play and targeted for younger childrens.

It's a free print and play game that I made for my daughter.

Name: Mine Layers
Description: Each player, two, take control of one mine layer truck. Players move around the combat field laying mines and pursuing the enemy. The first one to get touched by 4 mines or to get his or her engines destoyed loses the game.

Name: Marooned Part I: Open Sea
Description:
Your ship has been sunk and your stranded in the middle of the open sea.  Survive the attacks of the sharks and the  krakens in this area and make it to the island you've spotted off in the distance.

See the files section for the rules and the pictures section for the playerboard and dice labels.

Open Sea is a free, solitaire, print and play dice game.  Enjoy and let's hear your suggestions.

Name: The Kids are All Right
Description: An electronic board game based on the BBC show of the same name. Adults compete to win through four taxing rounds, but must beat kids aged 9 to 15 to take home the prize.

Name: Vampires' Dance
Description:
For 7000 years, from the time of the first civilization through imperial Rome, the Dark Ages and on to the present day, two vampires must strive together to unite the rebellious forces of Vampirekind, knowing the thirst for ultimate power lurks in the heart of every vampire and in the end, only one can rule.

Play moves through a unique combination of significant years that dramatically affect each game. Each player must skillfully balance their present needs, their alliance and their long-term agenda for dominance.

Vampires' Dance was a free print-and-play card game developed as part of a BGG competition.

Name: Equilibrium
Description: In Equilibrium, each player takes control of a fledgling country and tries to bring balance to it's economic, political and military aspects.  Beyond the theme, Equilibrium is a novel card game in which each player will slowly deconstruct a deck of cards. To play cards into your play area, you have to remove other cards permanently from your deck.  Score cards played will reward players for the cards left in their deck.  However, each card left in their deck also scores -1 VP no matter what.  Players can decide to end their game on any turn... once they think their deck has reached "Equilibrium".

Name: The Champ
Description: Two players take the role of a boxer each. Choose your actions and defeat your opponent! Uppercut, jab, blocking? Will you be eliminated? Fight your way to become The Champ!

Name: Auction Guru
Description: Bid and buy in order to earn the most wealth. But be careful, your opponents might trick you and make you waste your money! Buy hotels, cars, clubs or factories and become the wealthiest Auction Guru. Will you be the smartest buyer?

Name: Peloponnes: Expansion
Description: Expansion to Peloponnes. The Expansion includes the material for the sixth player along with new buildings and also the Sea-Expansion for more tactical options.

Name: Monopoly: Golf – Signature Holes Edition
Description: Drive for snow, putt for dough, and play golf’s greatest holes. With the Monopoly Golf Signature Holes Edition, you can now hit the links anytime! Buy, sell, and trade the renowned Pebble Beach #7, Whistling Straits #7, and Pinehurst #5 in a quest to own it all! Just like traditional golf, you’ll want to avoid the water, stay out of the sand, and steer clear of all the other course hazards. Own and play America’s foremost Signature Golf Holes without leaving your living room. The tee is open!

Name: Match Makers
Description:
Match Makers - an abstract game dripping with theme.

In this two-player card game the competitors try to lead promising couples from first love through engagement to a happy wedding. You will be
 - drawing characters from the character deck,
 - forming new enamored couples,
 - strengthening the relationship of your couples through engagement or marriage and
 - seducing your opponent's characters.

Couples that have many common interests are less vulnerable to seduction, but will also earn less points in the final scoring.

Friends of tile laying games will enjoy the hunt for every opportunity to break up opposing twosomes. A good timing of the available actions - combined with swift adaption to the rule changes triggered by the marriage licenses - is the key to success. You can play on the safe side, but should definitely take some risk when your opponent has a limited hand.

More information at http://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/match-makers

Name: Monopoly: Here and Now All-Ireland Edition
Description: Monopoly Here & Now All-Ireland Edition features the 22 greatest Irish counties as voted by the public (almost 170,000 votes were cast).
